message.content:
cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.PL 

This paper discusses the security and privacy risks associated with mobile web browsers and their access to motion and orientation sensor data. It proposes an attack called TouchSignatures that can identify user touch actions and PINs based on this sensor data via JavaScript. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves human-computer interaction (cs.HC) as it studies the policies of popular browsers on Android and iOS platforms in granting permissions to JavaScript code. Additionally, it proposes potential solutions to address the vulnerabilities, which can fall under the sub-categories of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.CY (Computers and Society), and cs.PL (Programming Languages).
